item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对伊斯兰共和国的石油出口实施新制裁后，伊朗表示对美国政府在核谈判中的认真态度 "深表怀疑"。【原文：Iran said it was “deeply suspicious” of the US government’s seriousness in the nuclear talks after President Donald Trump announced fresh sanctions on the Islamic Republic’s oil exports.】

item.title: 银行交易的 8.67 亿美元减记暴露了高利率和波动性带来的持久痛苦
item.description: 今年最大的地区性银行合并案中出现了一些大额减值，凸显出高利率的影响在 2023 年银行业大震荡之后依然顽固存在。【原文：This year’s biggest regional bank merger comes with some big writedowns, underscoring how the impact of high interest rates stubbornly lingers after the industry’s 2023 convulsions.】

item.title: 矿业产量激增，智利经济活动反弹
item.description: 智利 3 月份的经济活动因采矿业的激增而反弹，而其他行业的涨幅则较为平缓，因为政府官员和中央银行警告说，未来的全球前景将动荡不安。【原文：Chile’s economic activity bounced back in March on a surge in mining, while other sectors posted more muted gains as government officials and the central bank warn of a turbulent global outlook ahead.】

item.title: 就业报告强劲，美国股指期货扩大涨幅
item.description: 周五，美国股市期货上涨，使 S&P 500 指数有望创下 20 多年来最长的连涨纪录。此前，一份政府报告显示 4 月份雇佣情况良好，为饱受贸易压力困扰的经济提供了恢复力的证据。【原文：US stock futures rose Friday, putting the S&P 500 Index on track to post the longest winning streak in more than 20 years after a government report showed buoyant hiring in April, providing evidence of resilience in an economy beset by trade pressures.】

item.title: 就业复苏引发美国经济增长反思，美国国债下跌
item.description: 美国就业数据强于预期，显示关税的不确定性尚未对美国就业市场造成实质性打击，促使交易商减少对即将降息的押注，此后国债下跌。【原文：Treasuries fell after stronger-than-expected US employment data that showed tariff uncertainty has yet to materially hit the nation’s jobs market, prompting traders to trim bets on imminent interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国薪资增长超出预期，大幅增加 17.7 万人
item.description: 美国 4 月份就业增长强劲，失业率保持稳定，表明唐纳德-特朗普总统贸易政策的不确定性尚未对招聘计划产生实质性影响。【原文：US job growth was robust in April and the unemployment rate held steady, suggesting uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s trade policy has yet to have a material impact on hiring plans.】

item.title: 关税和增长担忧加剧，苹果评级遭两次下调
item.description: 周五，苹果公司的评级至少被下调了两次，此前的季度财报加深了人们对关税及其增长潜力的担忧。【原文：Apple Inc. received at least two downgrades on Friday, following quarterly results that reinforced concerns over tariffs and its growth potential.】

item.title: 参议员沃伦敦促美联储重新考虑 Capital One 收购 Discover 的交易
item.description: 美国国会银行委员会的民主党高层呼吁美联储重新考虑批准 Capital One Financial Corp. 收购 Discover Financial Services 的决定，称这将对消费者和银行系统造成 "严重伤害"。【原文：The top Democrats on congressional banking committees called on the Federal Reserve to reconsider its decision to approve Capital One Financial Corp.’s purchase of Discover Financial Services, saying it would inflict “serious harm” on consumers and the banking system.】

item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印尼加鲁达航空公司（PT Garuda Indonesia）至少有15架喷气式飞机因难以支付维修费用而停飞，这表明该航空公司的复兴计划可能正在动摇。【原文：PT Garuda Indonesia has at least 15 jets grounded because it’s struggling to make maintenance payments, according to people familiar with the matter, in a sign the airline’s revival plans may be faltering.】

item.title: 食品通胀升温，但可能会有所缓解
item.description: 关税对经济和消费需求影响的担忧仍在持续，但地平线上却出现了一丝好消息：世界银行预计粮食商品价格将实际下降。【原文：As worries about the impact of tariffs on the economy and consumer demand persist, there’s a sliver of good news on the horizon: The World Bank expects food commodity prices to actually drop.】

item.title: 日本巴菲特支持的贸易公司做好应对关税影响的准备
item.description: 由巴菲特支持的日本大型贸易公司本周发布了谨慎的年度利润预测，预留了数百万美元用于对冲持续存在的关税不确定性。【原文：Major Japanese trading houses, backed by Warren Buffett, this week released cautious profit forecasts for the year, setting aside millions to hedge against persistent tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: 法国在经历冬季困境后迅速恢复天然气储存
item.description: 与欧盟其他成员国相比，法国的天然气库存增加最多，这标志着这个在去年冬天天然气库存急剧下降的国家迅速扭转了局面。【原文：France added the most natural gas to its inventories compared with other European Union members, marking a quick turnaround for a nation that saw stockpiles plummet this past winter.】

item.title: 埃克森与预期持平，即使石油价格下滑也坚持回购
item.description: 由于圭亚那和二叠纪等低成本项目的产量增加，埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）的盈利达到了预期，使这家石油巨头得以在近期原油价格下跌的情况下继续进行股票回购。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. met earnings estimates thanks to higher production from low-cost projects such as Guyana and the Permian, allowing the oil giant to maintain its share buybacks despite the recent drop in crude prices.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战和欧佩克打击油价，雪佛龙削减回购计划
item.description: 在油价暴跌之后，雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）本季度将削减股票回购，这表明唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战正在伤害他承诺帮助的美国关键产业。【原文：Chevron Corp. will slash share buybacks this quarter after oil prices have tumbled, indicating that President Donald Trump’s trade war is hurting a key US industry he pledged to help.】
